title: Fake News: NO Estimated 90,000 Cases of HIV in Vanderburgh County | Lead Stories
subtitle: Have an estimated 90,000 people in Evansville, Vanderburg County in Indiana been diagnosed with AIDS? No, that's not true: the...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Have an estimated 90,000 people in Evansville, Vanderburg County in Indiana been diagnosed with AIDS? No, that's not true: the news was posted by some joker to a prank website and it went viral despite the fact that the website clearly says it is a prank.

The story originated from an article published by Channel22News on September 9, 2018 titled "Estimated 90,000 cases of HIV in Vanderburgh County - Channel22News.com" (archived here) which opened:

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail where it looked like something from a real news website:

As of September 08, 2018, an estimated 90,000 Evansville residents have tested positive for the HIV virus. The federal government is calling for a state of emergency for the city. Residents are urged to get tested immediately to avoid being quarantined when the total reaches 120,000 infected persons. It has been reported that this is ...

The actual Vanderburgh County Health Department website makes no mention of the epidemic. The town of Evansville also only has 120,000 residents so having three quarters of them infected with HIV would be national news and yet no actual news outlets make any mention of the story.

That makes sense because the site spreading the hoax is part of a network of prank sites operated by Korry Scherer from Milwaukee, WI. according to WHOIS data. The site lets visitors create their own realistic looking fake news stories to prank friends and family.

The site seems to be part of a network of similar sites. So far we've found these, but there may be others:

The sites all come with disclaimers at the bottom of each prank:

We wrote about channel22news.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:
• Fake News: Meth NOT To Be Legalized In Haralson County, Georgia
• Fake News: Jake Paul NOT Injured In Car Accident, NO 2 Dead
